caption.center: STATE OF HAWAI`I, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. STEVE TATAII, Defendant-Appellant

court.center: Intermediate Court of Appeals of Hawaii.

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE FIRST CIRCUIT (Cr. No. 01011941)
opinion.attorneys: Steve Tataii, defendant-appellant, pro se, on the motion.

center.italic: ORDER DENYING MOTION TO DISMISS SUMMARY DISPOSITION ORDER

opinion.opinion_byline: BURNS, C.J., WATANABE, AND FOLEY, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
Upon consideration of "Appellant's Motion to Dismiss the Defected August 18, 2003 Summary Disposition Order Decision, Which Would Also Dismiss the September 3, 2003 Denied Order of Motion for Reconsideration for Bearing the Incorrect Appellant's Name, Causing This Court to Miss the Deadline to Issue an Order to Correct the Erroneous Decision Based on Addressing the Right Party" (upper case formatting added) filed by Defendant-Appellant Steve Tataii, pro se, on September 15, 2003 and the records and files in this case,
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the motion is denied.
